monster.name: Abjurer Wizard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

action.name: Force Blast
action.text: Each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from the abjurer must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the abjurer. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The abjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: dispel magic, lightning bolt, mage armor • 1/Day each: arcane lock, banishment, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, wall of force

reaction.name: Arcane Ward (Recharge 4-6)
reaction.text: When the abjurer or a creature it can see within 30 feet of it takes damage, the abjurer magically creates a protective barrier around itself or the other creature. The barrier reduces the damage to the protected creature by 26 (4d10 + 4), to a minimum of O, and then vanishes.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation, dispel magic, lightning bolt, mage armor, arcane lock, banishment, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, wall of force
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 260, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 209

monster.name: Adult Kruthik (MPMM)
monster.speed: walk 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., climb 40 ft.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kruthik makes two Stab or Spike attacks.

action.name: Stab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 169, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 212

monster.name: Adult Oblex (MPMM)

trait.name: Skills
trait.text: One of the following: Arcana +7, History +7, Nature +7, or Religion +7

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
trait.text: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oblex makes two pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Eat Memories
action.text:
The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.
While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from its ability checks and attack rolls. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends.
The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC DC 15):
• 3/Day each: charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern

action.name: Sulfurous Impersonation (Bonus Action)
action.text: The oblex extrudes a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 1d4 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. The simulacrum is an extension of the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

monster.spells: charm person, detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 198, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 218

monster.name: Air Elemental Myrmidon
monster.languages: Auran, one language of its creator's choice
monster.resist: lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The myrmidon makes three Flail attacks.

action.name: Flail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 6)
action.text: The myrmidon makes one Flail attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 18 (4d8) lightning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 122, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 202

monster.name: Alhoon
monster.skill: Arcana +8, Deception +7, History +8, Insight +7, Perception +7, Stealth +5
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The alhoon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The alhoon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alhoon makes two Chilling Grasp or ArcaneBolt attacks.

action.name: Chilling Grasp
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the alhoon regains 14 hit points.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) force damage.

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The alhoon magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The alhoon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: dancing lights, detect magic, detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: dominate monster, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, modify memory, plane shift (self only), wall of force

reaction.name: Negate Spell (3/Day)
reaction.text: The alhoon targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

monster.spells: dancing lights, detect magic, detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, prestidigitation, dominate monster, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, modify memory, plane shift, wall of force
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 43, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 172

monster.name: Alkilith
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Abyssal Rift
trait.text: If the alkilith surrounds a door, window, or similar opening continuously for 6d6 days, the opening becomes a permanent portal to a random layer of the Abyss.

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The alkilith can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the alkilith is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the alkilith move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the alkilith isn't ordinary slime or fungus.

trait.name: Foment Confusion
trait.text: Any creature that isn't a demon that starts its turn within 30 feet of the alkilith must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, or it hears a faint buzzing in its head for a moment and has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. If the saving throw against Foment Confusion fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the confusion spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the alkilith). While under the effect of that confusion, the creature is immune to Foment Confusion.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The alkilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The alkilith can climb difficult surfaces, such as upside down on ceilings, without making an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The alkilith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alkilith makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) acid damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 44, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 130

monster.name: Allip
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The allip can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The allip doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Maddening Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

action.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
action.text: Each creature within 30 feet of the allip that can hear it must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage, and it is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

action.name: Whispers of Compulsion
action.text: The allip chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the allip's choice that the allip can see. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 45, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 116

monster.name: Amnizu
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the amnizu's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The amnizu uses Blinding Rot or Forgetfulness, if available. It also makes two Taskmaster Whip attacks.

action.name: Taskmaster Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

action.name: Blinding Rot
action.text: The amnizu targets one or two creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and be blinded until the start of the amnizu's next turn.

action.name: Forgetfulness (Recharge 6)
action.text: The amnizu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 26 (4d12) psychic damage and become stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is stunned for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The amnizu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):
• At will: command • 3/Day: dominate monster • 1/Day: feeblemind

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm
reaction.text: When a creature within 60 feet of the amnizu makes an attack roll against it, and another creature is within the attack's range, the attacker must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including the amnizu or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw is successful, the attacker is immune to the amnizu's Instinctive Charm for 24 hours.

monster.spells: command, dominate monster, feeblemind
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 46, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 164

monster.name: Angry Sorrowsworn
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Rising Anger
trait.text: If another creature deals damage to the sorrowsworn, the sorrowsworn's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a Hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage. On its turn, the sorrowsworn has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: The sorrowsworn has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sorrowsworn makes two Hook attacks.

action.name: Hook
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 222, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 231

monster.name: Annis Hag
monster.resist: cold

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The annis makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Crushing Hug
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag's turns. The hag can't make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The hag casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• 3/Day each: disguise self (including the form of a Medium Humanoid), Fog cloud

monster.spells: disguise self, fog cloud
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 47, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 159

monster.name: Apprentice Wizard

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The apprentice casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: burning hands, disguise self, mage armor

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, burning hands, disguise self, mage armor
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 259, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 209

monster.name: Archdruid

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archdruid makes three Staff or Wildfire attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) poison damage.

action.name: Wildfire
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) fire damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the druid's next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The archdruid casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: beast sense, entangle, speak with animals • 3/Day each: animal messenger, dominate beast, faerie fire, tree stride • 1/Day each: commune with nature (as an action), mass cure wounds

action.name: Change Shape (2/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The archdruid magically transforms into a Beast or an Elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less and can remain in that form for up to 9 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form if it dies or falls unconscious. The archdruid can revert to its true form using a bonus action.
While in a new form, the archdruid's stat block is replaced by the stat block of that form, except the archdruid keeps its current hit points, its hit point maximum, this bonus action, its languages and ability to speak, and its Spellcasting action.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

monster.spells: beast sense, entangle, speak with animals, animal messenger, dominate beast, faerie fire, tree stride, commune with nature, mass cure wounds
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 48, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 210

monster.name: Archer

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archer makes two Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Archer's Eye (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Immediately after making an attack roll or a damage roll with a ranged weapon, the archer can roll a d10 and add the number rolled to the total.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 49, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 210

monster.name: Armanite
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The armanite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The armanite makes one Claw attack, one Hooves attack, and one Serrated Tail attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Serrated Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Lightning Lance (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The armanite looses a bolt of lightning in a line that is 60 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 50, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 131

monster.name: Astral Dreadnought
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
trait.text: The dreadnought's eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, it decides which way the cone faces. The cone doesn't function while the eye is closed or while the dreadnought is blinded.

trait.name: Astral Entity
trait.text: The dreadnought can't leave the Astral Plane, nor can it be banished or otherwise transported out of that plane.

trait.name: Demiplanar Donjon
trait.text: Anything the dreadnought swallows is transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a wish spell or the dreadnought's Bite and Donjon Visit. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the plane shift spell. The demiplane resembles a stone cave roughly 1,000 feet in diameter with a ceiling 100 feet high. Like a stomach, it contains the remains of past meals. The dreadnought can't be harmed from within the demiplane. If the dreadnought dies, the demiplane disappears, and everything inside it appears around the dreadnought's corpse. The demiplane is otherwise indestructible.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the dreadnought fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Sever Silver Cord
trait.text: If the dreadnought scores a critical hit against a creature traveling by means of the astral projection spell, the dreadnought can cut the target's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The dreadnought doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dreadnought makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (5d10 + 9) force damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and this damage reduces it to 0 hit points or it is incapacitated, the dreadnought swallows it. The swallowed target, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, appears in an unoccupied space on the floor of the Demiplanar Donjon.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) force damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The astral dreadnought can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The astral dreadnought regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Claw
legendary.text: The dreadnought makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Donjon Visit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: One Huge or smaller creature that the dreadnought can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space on the floor of the Demiplanar Donjon. At the end of the target's next turn, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

legendary.name: Psychic Projection (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Each creature within 60 feet of the dreadnought must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 26 (4d10 + 4) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 51, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 117

monster.name: Aurochs

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage. If the aurochs moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone if it is a creature.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 71, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 207

monster.name: Autumn Eladrin
monster.resist: psychic

trait.name: Enchanting Presence
trait.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Enchanting Presence for 24 hours. Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: hold person • 2/Day each: cure wounds (as a 5th-level spell), lesser restoration • 1/Day each: greater restoration, revivify

action.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Foster Peace
reaction.text: If a creature charmed by the eladrin hits with an attack roll while within 60 feet of the eladrin, the eladrin magically causes the attack to miss, provided the eladrin can see the attacker.

monster.spells: hold person, cure wounds, lesser restoration, greater restoration, revivify
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 115, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 195

monster.name: Babau
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The babau makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting or Weakening Gaze.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The babau casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11):
• At will: darkness, dispel magic, fear, heat metal, levitate

action.name: Weakening Gaze
action.text: The babau targets one creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: darkness, dispel magic, fear, heat metal, levitate
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 52, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 136

monster.name: Bael
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Dread
trait.text: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 10 feet of Bael must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of him until the start of its next turn. A creature succeeds on this saving throw automatically if Bael wishes it or if he is incapacitated.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Bael fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Bael have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Bael regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Bael dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Bael makes two Hellish Morningstar attacks.

action.name: Hellish Morningstar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) force damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Infernal Command
action.text: Each of Bael's allies within 60 feet of him can't be charmed or frightened until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Bael casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21):
• At will: alter self (can become Medium), charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image • 3/Day each: dispel magic, fly, suggestion, wall of fire • 1/Day: dominate monster

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Bael teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Bael can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Bael regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Fiendish Magic
legendary.text: Bael uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

legendary.name: Infernal Command
legendary.text: Bael uses Infernal Command.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Bael makes one Hellish Morningstar attack.

monster.spells: alter self, charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, dispel magic, fly, suggestion, wall of fire, dominate monster
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 54, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 170

monster.name: Balhannoth

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the balhannoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The balhannoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) and is moved up to 5 feet toward the balhannoth.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the balhannoth can't use this tentacle against other targets. The balhannoth has four tentacles.

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), a balhannoth can take one of the following lair actions; the balhannoth can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Teleport: The balhannoth targets one creature within 500 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, or the target, along with whatever it is wearing and carrying, teleports to an unoccupied space of the balhannoth's choice within 60 feet of it.
Vanish: The balhannoth targets one creature within 500 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, or the balhannoth becomes invisible to that creature for 1 minute. This effect ends if the balhannoth attacks the target.
Warp Terrain: The balhannoth warps reality around it in an area up to 500 feet square. After 10 minutes, the terrain in the area reshapes to assume the appearance of a location sought by one Humanoid whose desires the balhannoth has sensed (see Regional Effects below). The transformation affects nonliving material only and can't create anything with moving parts or magical properties. Any object created in this area is, upon close inspection, revealed as a fake. Books are filled with empty pages, golden items are obvious counterfeits, and so on. The transformation lasts until the balhannoth dies or takes this lair action again.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The balhannoth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The balhannoth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: The balhannoth makes one Bite attack against one creature it has grappled.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: The balhannoth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures it has grappled, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Vanish
legendary.text: The balhannoth magically becomes invisible for up to 10 minutes or until immediately after it makes an attack roll.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 55, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 119

monster.name: Banderhobb
monster.languages: understands Common and the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Resonant Connection
trait.text: If the banderhobb has even a tiny piece of a creature or an object in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the most direct route to that creature or object if it is within 1 mile of the banderhobb.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The banderhobb makes one Bite attack and one Tongue attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Shadow Step.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the banderhobb can't use its Bite attack or Tongue attack on another target.

action.name: Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to a space within 5 feet of the banderhobb.

action.name: Shadow Step
action.text: The banderhobb teleports up to 30 feet to an un occupied space of dim light or darkness that it can see.

action.name: Swallow
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature grappled by the banderhobb. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage. The creature is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the banderhobb, and it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the banderhobb's turns. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way stops taking the necrotic damage and becomes stable.
The banderhobb can have only one creature swallowed at a time. While the banderhobb isn't incapacitated, it can regurgitate the creature at any time (no action required) in a space within 5 feet of it. The creature exits prone. If the banderhobb dies, it likewise regurgitates a swallowed creature.

action.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the banderhobb takes the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 56, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 122

monster.name: Baphomet
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: Baphomet can perfectly recall any path he has traveled, and he is immune to the maze spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Baphomet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Baphomet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Baphomet makes one Bite attack, one Gore attack, and one Heartcleaver attack. He also uses Frightful Presence.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d6 + 10) piercing damage. If Baphomet moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 16 (3d10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

action.name: Heartcleaver
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) force damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of Baphomet's choice within 120 feet of him and aware of him must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. These later saves have disadvantage if Baphomet is within line of sight of the creature. If a creature succeeds on any of these saves or the effect ends on it, the creature is immune to Baphomet's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Baphomet casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):
• 3/Day each: dispel magic, dominate beast, maze, wall of stone • 1/Day: teleport

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Baphomet can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Illusory Room. Baphomet casts mirage arcane, affecting a room within the lair that is no larger in any dimension than 100 feet. The effect ends on the next initiative count 20. Charisma is Baphomet's spellcasting ability for this spell. Reverse Gravity. Baphomet chooses a room within the lair that is no larger in any dimension than 100 feet. Until the next initiative count 20, gravity is reversed within that room. Any creatures or objects in the room when this happens fall in the direction of the new pull of gravity, unless they have some means of remaining aloft. Baphomet can ignore the gravity reversal if he's in the room, although he likes to use this action to land on a ceiling to attack targets flying near it. Seal the Way. Baphomet seals one doorway or other entryway within the lair. The opening must be unoccupied. It is filled with solid stone for 1 minute or until Baphomet takes this lair action again.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Baphomet can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Baphomet regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Heartcleaver Attack
legendary.text: Baphomet makes one Heartcleaver attack.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Baphomet moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then makes a Gore attack.

monster.spells: dispel magic, dominate beast, maze, wall of stone, teleport
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 58, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 143

monster.name: Bard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bard makes two Shortsword or Shortbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Cacophony (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from the bard must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 (2d8) thunder damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the bard. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The bard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: charm person, invisibility, sleep

action.name: Taunt (2/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bard targets one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the bard, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of the bard's next turn.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, charm person, invisibility, sleep
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 59, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 211

monster.name: Barghest
monster.speed: walk 60 ft. (30 ft. in goblin form)
monster.languages: Abyssal, Common, Goblin, Infernal, telepathy 60 ft.
monster.resist: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Fire Banishment
trait.text: When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be instantly banished to Gehenna.

trait.name: Soul Feeding
trait.text: The barghest can feed on the corpse of a Fey or Humanoid it killed within the past 10 minutes. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the corpse. The victim's soul is trapped in the barghest for 24 hours, after which time it is digested and the person is incapable of being revived. If the barghest dies before the soul is digested, the soul is released. While a soul is trapped in the barghest, any magic that tries to restore the soul to life has a 50 percent chance of failing and being wasted.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The barghest makes one Bite attack and oneClaw attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The barghest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: levitate, minor illusion, pass without trace • 1/Day each: charm person, dimension door, suggestion

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The barghest transforms into a Small goblin or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The barghest reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.spells: levitate, minor illusion, pass without trace, charm person, dimension door, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 60, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 123

monster.name: Berbalang

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The berbalang makes one Bite attack and oneClaw attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The berbalang casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: speak with dead • 1/Day: plane shift (self only)

action.name: Spectral Duplicate (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The berbalang creates one spectral duplicate of itself in an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it. While the duplicate exists, the berbalang is unconscious. A berbalang can have only one duplicate at a time. The duplicate disappears when it or the berbalang drops to 0 hit points or when the berbalang dismisses it (no action required).
The duplicate has the same statistics and knowledge as the berbalang, and everything experienced by the duplicate is known by the berbalang. All damage dealt by the duplicate's attacks is psychic damage.

monster.spells: speak with dead, plane shift
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 61, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 120

monster.name: Bheur Hag
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 50 ft. (hover, Graystaff magic)

trait.name: Control Weather (1/Day)
trait.text: The hag can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Graystaff Magic
trait.text: The hag carries a graystaff, a magic staff. The hag can use its flying speed only while astride the staff. If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff

trait.name: Ice Walk
trait.text: The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check, and difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost the hag extra moment.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hag makes two Slam or Frost Shard attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Shard
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d8 + 3) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the hag's next turn.

action.name: Horrific Feast
action.text: The hag feeds on the corpse of one enemy within reach that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag's choice that is within 60 feet and able to see the feeding must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the hag for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature is incapacitated, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Feast for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
While holding or riding the graystaff, the hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: hold person • 1/Day each: cone of cold, ice storm, wall of ice

monster.spells: hold person, cone of cold, ice storm, wall of ice
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 62, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 160

monster.name: Black Abishai
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abishai makes one Bite attack and two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Creeping Darkness (Recharge 6)
action.text: The abishai casts darkness at a point within 120 feet of it, requiring no spell components or concentration. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability for this spell. While the spell persists, the abishai can move the area of darkness up to 60 feet as a bonus action.

action.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the abishai takes the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 38, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 160

monster.name: Blackguard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blackguard makes three attacks, using Glaive, Shortbow, or both.

action.name: Glaive
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Aspect (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Each enemy within 30 feet of the blackguard must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the blackguard for 1 minute. If a frightened target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• 2/Day each: command, dispel magic, find steed

action.name: Smite (Bonus Action)
action.text:
Immediately after the blackguard hits a target with an attack roll, the blackguard can force that target to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers one of the following effects of the blackguard's choice:
Blind: The target is blinded for 1 minute. The blinded target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Shove: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

monster.spells: command, dispel magic, find steed
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 63, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 211

monster.name: Blue Abishai
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abishai makes three Bite or Lightning Strike attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (8d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The abishai casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion • 2/Day each: charm person, dispel magic, greater invisibility, wall of force

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The abishai teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

monster.spells: disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion, charm person, dispel magic, greater invisibility, wall of force
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 39, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 161

monster.name: Bodak
monster.languages: Abyssal, the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: cold, fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Death Gaze
trait.text: When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The bodak doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Withering Gaze
action.text: One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Aura of Annihilation (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bodak activates or deactivates this deathly aura. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and Fiends ignore this effect.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 64, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 127

monster.name: Boggle
monster.resist: fire

action.name: Pummel
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Oil Puddle
action.text:
The boggle creates a puddle of nonflammable oil. The puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain for all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour. The oil has one of the following additional effects of the boggle's choice:
Slippery Oil. Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
Sticky Oil. Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained. On its turn, a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself, ending the effect and moving into the nearest unoccupied space of its choice with a successful DC 11 Strength check.

action.name: Boggle Oil (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores, giving itself one of the following benefits of its choice until it uses this bonus action again:
Slippery Oil. The boggle has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds and end grapples, and it can move through openings large enough for a Tiny creature without squeezing.
Sticky Oil. The boggle has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. The boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Dimensional Rift (Bonus Action)
action.text: The boggle creates an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame it can see within 5 feet of it, provided that the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. The dimensional rift bridges the distance between that space and a point within 30 feet of it that the boggle can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). While next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. Only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 65, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 128, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 229

monster.name: Boneclaw
monster.languages: Common plus one language spoken by its master
monster.resist: cold, necrotic

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: While its master lives, a destroyed boneclaw gains a new body in 1d10 hours, with all its hit points. The new body appears within 1 mile of the boneclaw's master.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The boneclaw doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The boneclaw makes two Piercing Claw attacks.

action.name: Piercing Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, the boneclaw can pull the target up to 10 feet toward itself, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). The boneclaw has two claws. While a claw grapples a target, the claw can attack only that target.

action.name: Shadow Jump (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: If the boneclaw is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the boneclaw's choice within 15 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 34 (5d12 + 2) necrotic damage. The boneclaw then teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the boneclaw takes the Hide action.

reaction.name: Deadly Reach
reaction.text: In response to a creature entering a space within 15 feet of it, the boneclaw makes one Piercing Claw attack against that creature.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 66, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 121

monster.name: Brontosaurus

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 95, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 139

monster.name: Bulezau
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

trait.name: Rotting Presence
trait.text: When any creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of the bulezau, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The bulezau's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The bulezau has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Barbed Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease ends. While poisoned in this way, the target sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin, and the target must repeat the saving throw after every 24 hours that elapse. On a successful save, the disease ends. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 4 (1d8). The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 67, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 131

monster.name: Cadaver Collector
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak
monster.immune: necrotic, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The collector makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

action.name: Summon Specters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; 1d4 specters (without Sunlight Sensitivity) arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. The specters act right after the collector on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the collector is destroyed.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 68, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 122

monster.name: Canoloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Dimensional Lock
trait.text: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within 60 feet of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Uncanny Senses
trait.text: The canoloth can't be surprised unless it's incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The canoloth makes one Bite or Tongue attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

action.name: Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 69, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 247

monster.name: Catoblepas

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

action.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 70, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 129

monster.name: Cave Fisher

trait.name: Flammable Blood
trait.text: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Retract Filament
action.text: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

action.name: Adhesive Filament (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape DC 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful DC 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. The filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 73, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 130

monster.name: Champion

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
trait.text: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The champion makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The champion regains 20 hit points.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 74, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 212

monster.name: Chitine

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The chitine has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the chitine to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The chitine ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chitine makes three Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 75, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 131

monster.name: Choker

trait.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

trait.name: Boneless
trait.text: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spicier Climb
trait.text: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The choker makes two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 76, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 123

monster.name: Choldrith

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: guidance, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: bane, hold person

action.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The choldrith conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The choldrith can make a melee spell attack (+4 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 6 (1d8 + 2) force damage. The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the choldrith can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.

monster.spells: guidance, thaumaturgy, bane, hold person
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 77, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 132

monster.name: Clockwork Bronze Scout
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Earth Armor
trait.text: The clockwork doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it burrows.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Flare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Each creature in contact with the ground within 15 feet of the clockwork must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 79, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 125

monster.name: Clockwork Iron Cobra
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or suffer one random effect (roll a d6):
Random Effect: d6 | Effect 1-2 | Confusion: On its next turn, the target must use its action to make one weapon attack against a random creature it can see within 30 feet of it, using whatever weapon it has in hand and moving beforehand if necessary to get in range. If it's holding no weapon, it makes an unarmed strike. If no creature is visible within 30 feet, it takes the Dash action, moving toward the nearest creature. 3-4 | Paralysis: The target is paralyzed until the end of its next turn. 5-6 | Poison: The target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 79, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 125

monster.name: Clockwork Oaken Bolter
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The clockwork makes two Lancing Bolt attacks or one Lancing Bolt attack and one Harpoon attack.

action.name: Lancing Bolt
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
action.text:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12).
While grappled in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the clockwork. A creature takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The clockwork can grapple only one creature at a time with its harpoon.

action.name: Explosive Bolt (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The clockwork launches an explosive charge at a point within 120 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Reel In (Bonus Action)
action.text: The clockwork pulls the creature grappled by its Harpoon up to 20 feet closer.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 80, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 126

monster.name: Clockwork Stone Defender
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

reaction.name: Intercept Attack
reaction.text: In response to another creature within 5 feet of it being hit by an attack roll, the clockwork gives that creature a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack, potentially causing a miss. To use this ability, the clockwork must be able to see the creature and the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 80, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 126

monster.name: Cloud Giant Smiling One
monster.skill: Deception +11, Insight +7, Perception +11, Sleight Of Hand +9

trait.name: Control Weather (8th-level Spell)
trait.text: The giant can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two Slam attacks or two Telekinetic Strike attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Strike
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 240 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The giant magically transforms to look and feel like a Beast or a Humanoid it has seen or to return to its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, don't change. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion • 3/Day each: invisibility, silent image, suggestion, tongues • 1/Day each: gaseous form, major image

action.name: Cloud Step (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The giant teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: Control Weather, detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion, invisibility, silent image, suggestion, tongues, gaseous form, major image
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 81, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 146

monster.name: Conjurer Wizard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The conjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The conjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: fireball, mage armor, unseen servant • 1/Day each: fly, stinking cloud, web
