action.name: Benign Transportation (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The conjurer teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

action.name: Summon Elemental (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The conjurer magically summons an air elemental, an earth elemental, a fire elemental, or a water elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the conjurer, whom it obeys. It takes its turn immediately after the conjurer. It lasts for 1 hour, until it or the conjurer dies, or until the conjurer dismisses it as a bonus action.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, fireball, mage armor, unseen servant, fly, stinking cloud, web
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 260, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 212

monster.name: Corpse Flower

trait.name: Corpses
trait.text: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stench of Death
trait.text: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The corpse flower makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Harvest the Dead
action.text: The corpse flower swallows one unsecured Humanoid corpse within 10 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

action.name: Digest (Bonus Action)
action.text: The corpse flower digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested corpse remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

action.name: Reanimate (Bonus Action)
action.text: The corpse flower animates one corpse in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see Stench of Death).

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 82, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 127

monster.name: Cranium Rat

trait.name: Telepathic Shroud
trait.text: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cranium rat sheds dim light from its exposed brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguishes the light.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 83, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 133

monster.name: Darkling

trait.name: Death Flash
trait.text: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
trait.text: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 84, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 134

monster.name: Darkling Elder

trait.name: Death Burn
trait.text: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The darkling elder makes two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The darkling elder casts darkness, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 84, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 134

monster.name: Death Kiss

trait.name: Lightning Blood
trait.text: A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The death kiss makes three Tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain—one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

action.name: Blood Drain
action.text: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 85, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 124

monster.name: Deathlock
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

action.name: Deathly Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

action.name: Grave Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand • 1/Day each: dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand, dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 86, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 128

monster.name: Deathlock Mastermind
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the deathlock's darkvision.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

action.name: Deathly Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3 necrotic damage).

action.name: Grave Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion • 1/Day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion, darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 87, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 129

monster.name: Deathlock Wight
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the deathlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deathlock makes two Life Drain or Grave Bolt attacks.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the deathlock's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The deathlock can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Grave Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor • 1/Day each: fear, hold person

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, fear, hold person
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 87, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 129

monster.name: Deep Rothé

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The rothé is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the rothé moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

action.name: Dancing Lights
action.text: The rothé casts dancing lights, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

monster.spells: dancing lights
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 71, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Deep Scion
monster.speed: walk 30 ft. (20 ft. and swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)
monster.skill: Deception +6, Insight +3, Sleight Of Hand +3, Stealth +3

trait.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
trait.text: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deep scion makes two Battleaxe attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The deep scion transforms into a hybrid form (humanoid-piscine) or back into its true form, which is humanlike. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 88, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 135

monster.name: Deinonychus

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 95, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 139

monster.name: Demogorgon
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Demogorgon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Demogorgon makes two Tentacle attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Gaze.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Gaze
action.text:
Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):
Gaze Effect: d6 | Effect 1-2 | Beguiling Gaze: The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight. 3-4 | Confusing Gaze: The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell. 5-6 | Hypnotic Gaze: The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its action, reaction, and movement.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Demogorgon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):
• At will: detect magic, major image • 3/Day each: dispel magic, fear, telekinesis • 1/Day each: feeblemind, project image

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Demogorgon can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Darkness: Demogorgon casts the darkness spell four times, targeting different areas with the spell. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spells, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round.
Illusory Duplicate: Demogorgon creates an illusory duplicate of himself, which appears in his space and lasts until initiative count 20 of the next round. On his turn, Demogorgon can move the illusory duplicate a distance equal to his walking speed (no action required). The first time a creature or an object interacts physically with Demogorgon (for example, by hitting him with an attack), there is a 50 percent chance that the illusory duplicate is affected, not Demogorgon, in which case the illusion disappears.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: Demogorgon can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Demogorgon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Gaze
legendary.text: Demogorgon uses Gaze and must use either Beguiling Gaze or Confusing Gaze.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Demogorgon uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: detect magic, major image, dispel magic, fear, telekinesis, feeblemind, project image
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 90, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 144

monster.name: Derro

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Hooked Spear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the derro can choose to deal no damage and knock it prone.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 91, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 158

monster.name: Derro Savant

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chromatic Beam
action.text: The derro launches a brilliant beam of magical energy in a 5-foot-wide line that is 60 feet long. Each creature in the line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The derro casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: mage hand, message, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: invisibility, sleep, spider climb

monster.spells: mage hand, message, prestidigitation, invisibility, sleep, spider climb
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 92, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 159

monster.name: Devourer
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Imprison Soul
action.text: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

action.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
action.text: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 93, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 138

monster.name: Dhergoloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dhergoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dhergoloth makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Flailing Claws (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dhergoloth moves up to its speed in a straight line and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The dhergoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 10):
• At will: darkness, fear

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The dhergoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: darkness, fear
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 94, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 248

monster.name: Dimetrodon

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 95, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 139

monster.name: Dire Troll
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Whirlwind of Claws (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Each creature within 10 feet of the troll must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 246, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 243

monster.name: Diviner Wizard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The diviner makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) radiant damage.

action.name: Overwhelming Revelation (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The diviner magically creates a burst of illumination in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of the diviner's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The diviner casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: mage hand, message, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: arcane eye, detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, lightning bolt, locate object, mage armor, Rary's telepathic bond • 1/Day: true seeing

reaction.name: Portent (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the diviner or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the diviner rolls a d20 and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the d20 rolled for the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, prestidigitation, arcane eye, detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, lightning bolt, locate object, mage armor, Rary's telepathic bond, true seeing
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 261, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 213

monster.name: Dolphin

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the dolphin moved at least 30 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 97, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Dolphin Delighter

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dolphin makes two Dazzling Slam attacks.

action.name: Dazzling Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the dolphin's next turn.

action.name: Delightful Light (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dolphin magically emanates light in a 10-foot radius for a moment. The dolphin and each creature of its choice in that light gain 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

action.name: Fey Leap (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dolphin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Immediately before teleporting, the dolphin can choose one creature within 5 feet of it. That creature can teleport with the dolphin, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dolphin's destination space.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 97

monster.name: Draegloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The draegloth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The draegloth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The draegloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11):
• At will: dancing lights, darkness • 1/Day each: confusion, faerie fire

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, confusion, faerie fire
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 98, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 141

monster.name: Drow Arachnomancer
monster.languages: Elvish, Undercommon, can speak with spiders
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The drow can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The drow ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes three attacks, using Bite, Poisonous Touch, Web, or a combination of them. One attack can be replaced by a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite (Spider Form Only)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Poisonous Touch (Humanoid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (10d6) poison damage.

action.name: Web (Spider Form Only; (Recharge 5-6))
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand • 1/Day each: darkness, dispel magic, etherealness, faerie fire, fly, insect plague, invisibility

action.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The drow magically transforms into a Large spider, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying in Humanoid form melds into the spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to its Humanoid form if it dies.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, darkness, dispel magic, etherealness, faerie fire, fly, insect plague, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 99, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 182

monster.name: Drow Favored Consort

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes three Scimitar or Arcane Eruption attacks. The drow can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) poison damage.

action.name: Arcane Eruption
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (8d8) force damage, and the drow can push the target up to 10 feet away if it is a Large or smaller creature.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):
• At will: dancing lights, mage armor, mage hand, message • 3/Day each: dimension door, fireball, invisibility • 1/Day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

reaction.name: Protective Shield (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the drow or a creature within 10 feet of it is hit by an attack roll, the drow gives the target a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of the drow's next turn, which can cause the triggering attack roll to miss.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage armor, mage hand, message, dimension door, fireball, invisibility, darkness, faerie fire, levitate
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 100, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 183

monster.name: Drow House Captain

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes two Scimitar attacks and one Whip or Hand Crossbow attack.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour.
If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

action.name: Battle Command (Bonus Action)
action.text: Choose one creature within 30 feet of the drow that the drow can see. If the chosen creature can see or hear the drow, that creature can use its reaction to make one melee attack or to take the Dodge or Hide action.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack roll that would hit it. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, levitate
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 101, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 184

monster.name: Drow Inquisitor

trait.name: Discern Lie
trait.text: The drow discerns when a creature in earshot speaks a lie in a language the drow knows.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes three Death Lance attacks.

action.name: Death Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow's casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):
• At will: dancing lights, detect magic, message, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, levitate (self only), silence, suggestion, true seeing

action.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The drow conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The drow can make a melee spell attack (+10 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 9 (1d8 + 5) force damage. The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the drow can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.

monster.spells: dancing lights, detect magic, message, thaumaturgy, clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, levitate, silence, suggestion, true seeing
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 102, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 184

monster.name: Drow Matron Mother

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: The drow wields a tentacle rod.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes two Demon Staff attacks or one Demon Staff attack and three Tentacle Rod attacks.

action.name: Demon Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the drow for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tentacle Rod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is hit three times by the rod on one turn, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects for 1 minute: the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Divine Flame (2/Day)
action.text: A 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high column of divine fire sprouts in an area up to 120 feet away from the drow. Each creature in the column must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: command, dancing lights, detect magic, thaumaturgy • 2/Day each: banishment, blade barrier, cure wounds, hold person, plane shift, silence • 1/Day each: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, gate, levitate (self only), suggestion

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the drow can take one of the following lair actions when in her lair; she can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Perceive Interlopers. The drow projects her mind throughout her lair, marking any potential threats against her or her retinue. Until initiative count 20 of the next round, hostile creatures within the lair can't become hidden from her and gain no benefit from the invisible condition against her. Spectral Web. A glistening spectral spider web erupts from a point the drow can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature within 60 feet of that point must succeed a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Telekinetic Throw. The drow targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her and attempts to expel it from her presence. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be flung 2d6 × 10 feet through the air. A creature smashed into a solid object takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved. If released in midair, the creature takes falling damage as normal.

action.name: Lolth's Fickle Favor (Bonus Action)
action.text: The drow bestows the Spider Queen's blessing on one ally she can see within 30 feet of her. The ally takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage but has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Summon Servant (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The drow magically summons a glabrezu or a yochlol. The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The drow matron mother can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The drow matron mother regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Compel Demon
legendary.text: An allied demon within 30 feet of the drow uses its reaction to make one attack against a target of the drow's choice that she can see.

legendary.name: Demon Staff
legendary.text: The drow makes one Demon Staff attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The drow uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: command, dancing lights, detect magic, thaumaturgy, banishment, blade barrier, cure wounds, hold person, plane shift, silence, clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, gate, levitate, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 104, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 186

monster.name: Drow Shadowblade

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the drow's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drow makes three Shadow Sword attacks. One of the attacks can be replaced by a Hand Crossbow attack. The drow can also use Spellcasting to cast darkness.

action.name: Shadow Sword
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (7d6 + 5) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour.
If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: dancing lights, darkness • 1/Day each: faerie fire, levitate (self only)

action.name: Shadow Step (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the drow teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, levitate
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 105, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 187

monster.name: Duergar Despot

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psychic Engine
trait.text: When the duergar suffers a critical hit or is reduced to 0 hit points, psychic energy erupts from its frame to deal 14 (4d6) psychic damage to each creature within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes two Iron Fist attacks and two Stomping Foot attacks. After one of the attacks, the duergar can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Flame Jet.

action.name: Iron Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away in a straight line and be knocked prone.

action.name: Stomping Foot
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, or 21 (3d10 + 5) to a prone target.

action.name: Flame Jet
action.text: The duergar spews flames in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The duergar casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: mage hand, minor illusion • 1/Day: stinking cloud

monster.spells: mage hand, minor illusion, stinking cloud
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 107, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 188

monster.name: Duergar Hammerer
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The hammerer deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hammerer makes one Claw attack and one Hammer attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Hammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Engine of Pain
reaction.text: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of the hammerer hits it with an attack roll, the hammerer makes a Hammer attack against that creature.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 112, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 188, Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 286

monster.name: Duergar Kavalrachni
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Cavalry Training
trait.text: When the duergar hits a target with a melee attack while mounted, the mount can use its reaction to make one melee attack against the same target.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes two War Pick attacks.

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

action.name: Shared Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it. While the invisible duergar is mounted, the mount is invisible as well. The invisibility ends early on the mount immediately after it attacks.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 107, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 189

monster.name: Duergar Mind Master
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes two Mind-Poison Dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Mind Mastery.

action.name: Mind-Poison Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, or 1 piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage while under the effect of Reduce.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.name: Mind Mastery
action.text: The duergar targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw, or the duergar causes it to use its reaction, if available, either to make one weapon attack against another creature the duergar can see or to move up to 10 feet in a direction of the duergar's choice. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

action.name: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically decreases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While reduced, the duergar is Tiny, reduces its weapon damage to 1, and makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage if they use Strength. It gains a +5 bonus to all Dexterity (Stealth) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. It can also take a bonus action on each of its turns to take the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 108, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 189, Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 286

monster.name: Duergar Screamer
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The screamer makes one Drill attack, and it uses Sonic Scream.

action.name: Drill
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Sonic Scream
action.text: The screamer emits destructive energy in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Engine of Pain
reaction.text: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of the screamer hits it with an attack roll, the screamer makes a Drill attack against that creature.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 111, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 190

monster.name: Duergar Soulblade
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Soulblade
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) force damage, or 13 (3d6 + 3) force damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 109, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 190

monster.name: Duergar Stone Guard
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of an ally wielding a shield.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes two Shortsword or Javelin attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1 d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 110, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 191

monster.name: Duergar Warlord
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The duergar makes three Psychic-Attuned Hammer or Javelin attacks and uses Call to Attack.

action.name: Psychic-Attuned Hammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

action.name: Call to Attack
action.text: Up to three allies within 120 feet of this duergar that can hear it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

reaction.name: Scouring Instruction
reaction.text: When an ally that the duergar can see makes a d20 roll, the duergar can roll a d6, and the ally can add the number rolled to the d20 by taking 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 111, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 192

monster.name: Duergar Xarrorn
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Fire Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage, or 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: From its fire lance, the duergar shoots a 15-foot cone of fire or a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.
