While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) cold damage.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) force damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) thunder damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Hutijin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22):
• At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only), lightning bolt, suggestion, wall of fire • 3/Day: dispel magic

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Hutijin teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

reaction.name: Fearful Voice (Recharge 5-6)
reaction.text: In response to taking damage, Hutijin utters a dreadful word of power. Each creature within 30 feet of him that isn't a devil must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect is immune to his Fearful Voice for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Day)
legendary.text: Hutijin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Hutijin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Hutijin makes one Claw, Mace, or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Hutijin uses Teleport.

legendary.name: Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Hutijin releases lightning in a 30-foot radius, blocked only by total cover. All other creatures in that area must each make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 157, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 175

monster.name: Hydroloth
monster.resist: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The hydroloth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The hydroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Secure Memory
trait.text: The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx, as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

trait.name: Watery Advantage
trait.text: While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has advantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hydroloth makes two Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The hydroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only) • 3/Day each: control water, crown of madness, fear, suggestion

action.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
action.text: The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies; it can't cast spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The hydroloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility, control water, crown of madness, fear, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 158, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 249

monster.name: Illusionist Wizard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The illusionist makes two Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The illusionist casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion • 2/Day each: disguise self, invisibility, mage armor, major image, phantasmal force, phantom steed

action.name: Displacement (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The illusionist projects an illusion that makes the illusionist appear to be standing in a place a few inches from its actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against the illusionist. The effect lasts for 1 minute, and it ends early if the illusionist takes damage, if it is incapacitated, or if its speed becomes 0.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, disguise self, invisibility, mage armor, major image, phantasmal force, phantom steed
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 263, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 214

monster.name: Juiblex
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: acid, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, unconscious

trait.name: Foul
trait.text: Any creature other than an Ooze that starts its turn within 10 feet of Juiblex must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Juiblex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Juiblex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Juiblex regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Juiblex dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Juiblex can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Juiblex makes three Acid Lash attacks.

action.name: Acid Lash
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) acid damage. Any creature killed by this attack is drawn into Juiblex's body, where the corpse is dissolved after 1 minute.

action.name: Eject Slime (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Juiblex spews out a corrosive slime, targeting one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) acid damage. Unless the target avoids taking all of this damage, any metal armor worn by the target takes a permanent -1 penalty to the AC it offers, and any metal weapon the target is carrying or wearing takes a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls. The penalty worsens each time a target is subjected to this effect. If the penalty on an object drops to -5, the object is destroyed. The penalty on an object can be removed by the mending spell.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Juiblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: detect magic • 3/Day each: contagion, gaseous form

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Juiblex can take one of the following lair actions; it can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Green Slime. A green slime (see the Dungeon Master's Guide) appears on a spot on the ceiling that Juiblex chooses within the lair. The slime disintegrates after 1 hour. Slippery Slime. Juiblex slimes a square area of ground it can see within the lair. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. When the slime appears, each creature on it must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone and slide 10 feet in a random direction determined by a d8 roll. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save. The slime lasts for 1 hour or until it is burned away with fire. If the slime is set on fire, it burns away after 1 round. Any creature that starts its turn in the burning slime takes 22 (4d10) fire damage. Sticky Slime. Juiblex slimes a square area of ground it can see within the lair. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. When the slime appears, each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or become restrained. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save. A restrained creature is stuck as long as it remains in the slimy area or until it breaks free. The restrained creature, or another creature that can reach it, can use its action to try to break free and must succeed on a DC 21 Strength check. The slime lasts for 1 hour or until it is burned away with fire. If the slime is set on fire, it burns away after 1 round. Any creature that starts its turn in the burning slime takes 22 (4d10) fire damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Juiblex can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Juiblex regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Juiblex makes one Acid Lash attack.

legendary.name: Corrupting Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) poison damage, and the target is slimed.
Until the slime is scraped off with an action, the target is poisoned, and any creature, other than an Ooze, is poisoned while within 10 feet of the target.

monster.spells: detect magic, contagion, gaseous form
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 160, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 151

monster.name: Ki-rin

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ki-rin makes two Hoof attacks and one Horn attack, or it makes two Sacred Fire attacks.

action.name: Hoof
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) force damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) radiant damage.

action.name: Sacred Fire
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The ki-rin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: light, major image (6th-level version), thaumaturgy • 3/Day each: cure wounds, dispel magic, lesser restoration, sending • 1/Day each: banishment, calm emotions, create food and water, greater restoration, plane shift, protection from evil and good, revivify, wind walk

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), a kirin can take one of the following lair actions, and it must finish a long rest before taking the chosen lair action again:
Create Comforts. The ki-rin conjures up one or more permanent objects made of soft, plant-based material—including manufactured objects like pillows, rope, blankets, and clothing—that can collectively fill no more than a 20-foot cube. The objects materialize 1 minute later in unoccupied spaces of the ki-rin's choice on the floor of the lair. Create Stone and Metal. The ki-rin conjures up one or more temporary objects made of stone or metal that can collectively fill no more than a 2-foot cube. The objects materialize 1 minute later in unoccupied spaces of the ki-rin's choice on the floor of the lair, and the objects vanish after 1 hour. Create Wood. The ki-rin conjures up one or more permanent objects made of wood, or similarly hard plant-based material, that can collectively fill no more than a 10-foot cube. The objects materialize 1 minute later in unoccupied spaces of the ki-rin's choice on the floor of the lair.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The ki-rin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ki-rin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The ki-rin moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Smite
legendary.text: The ki-rin makes one Hoof, Horn, or Sacred Fire attack.

monster.spells: light, major image, thaumaturgy, cure wounds, dispel magic, lesser restoration, sending. banishment, calm emotions, create food and water, greater restoration, plane shift, protection from evil and good, revivify, wind walk
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 162, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 163

monster.name: Kobold Dragonshield
monster.resist: see Dragon's Resistance below

trait.name: Dragon's Resistance
trait.text: The kobold has resistance to a type of damage based on the color of dragon that invested it with power (choose or roll a d10): 1-2, acid (black or copper); 3-4, cold (silver or white); 5-6, fire (brass, gold, or red); 7-8, lightning (blue or bronze); 9-10, poison (green).

trait.name: Heart of the Dragon
trait.text: If the kobold is frightened or paralyzed by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within 30 feet of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kobold makes two Spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 163, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 165

monster.name: Kobold Inventor

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Weapon Invention
action.text:
The kobold uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d8); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day: 1: Acid The kobold hurls a flask of acid. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage. 2: Alchemist's Fire The kobold throws a flask of alchemist's fire. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns. The target can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.
3: Basket of Centipedes The kobold throws a small basket into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of insects (centipedes) with 11 hit points emerges from the basket and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.
4: Green Slime Pot The kobold throws a clay pot full of green slime at the target, and it breaks open on impact. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) acid damage, and the target is covered in slime until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the slime off.
A target covered in the slime takes 5 (1d10) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.
5: Rot Grub Pot The kobold throws a clay pot into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it, and it breaks open on impact. A swarm of rot grubs (in this book) emerges from the shattered pot and remains a hazard in that square.
6: Scorpion on a Stick The kobold makes a melee attack with a scorpion tied to the end of a 5-foot-long pole. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
7: Skunk in a Cage The kobold releases a skunk into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The skunk has a walking speed of 20 feet, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks. It rolls initiative and, on its turn, uses its action to spray musk at a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, or it retches and is incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that doesn't need to breathe or is immune to poison automatically succeeds on the saving throw. Once the skunk has sprayed its musk, it can't do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.
8: Wasp Nest in a Bag The kobold throws a small bag into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of insects (wasps) with 11 hit points emerges from the bag and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 164, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 165

monster.name: Kobold Scale Sorcerer

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kobold makes two Dagger or Chromatic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Chromatic Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 60 feet, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) of a type of the kobold's choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The kobold casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: mage hand, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: charm person, fog cloud, levitate

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, charm person, fog cloud, levitate
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 165, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 167

monster.name: Korred
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The korred makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: commune with nature (as an action), meld into stone, stone shape • 1/Day: Otto's irresistible dance

action.name: Command Hair (Bonus Action)
action.text: The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. The korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated. A rope of korred hair has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korred's turns while the rope has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

monster.spells: commune with nature, meld into stone, stone shape, Otto's irresistible dance
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 166, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 168

monster.name: Kraken Priest

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The priest can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The priest makes two Thunderous Touch or Thunderbolt attacks.

action.name: Thunderous Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d10) thunder damage.

action.name: Thunderbolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage, and the target is knocked prone.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: command, create or destroy water • 3/Day each: control water, darkness, water breathing, water walk • 1/Day: Evard's black tentacles

action.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: A kraken speaks through the priest with a thunderous voice audible within 300 feet. Creatures of the priest's choice that can hear the kraken's words (which are spoken in Abyssal, Infernal, or Primordial) must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the priest for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: command, create or destroy water, control water, darkness, water breathing, water walk, Evard's black tentacles
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 167, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 215

monster.name: Kruthik Hive Lord (MPMM)
monster.speed: walk 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., climb 40 ft.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kruthik makes two Stab or Spike attacks.

action.name: Stab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The kruthik sprays acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 169, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 212

monster.name: Leucrotta

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within 5 feet of the leucrotta must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The leucrotta makes one Bite attack and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Kicking Retreat (Bonus Action)
action.text: Immediately after the leucrotta makes a Hooves attack, it takes the Disengage action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 170, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 169

monster.name: Leviathan
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Partial Freeze
trait.text: If the leviathan takes 50 cold damage or more during a single turn, the leviathan partially freezes; until the end of its next turn, its speeds are reduced to 20 feet, and it makes attack rolls with disadvantage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The leviathan deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Form
trait.text: The leviathan can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The leviathan makes one Slam attack and one Tail attack.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) acid damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

action.name: Tidal Wave (Recharge 6)
action.text: The leviathan magically creates a wave of water that extends from a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The wave is up to 250 feet long, up to 250 feet tall, and up to 50 feet wide. Each creature in the wave must make a DC 24 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (7d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 250 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The leviathan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The leviathan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The leviathan moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The leviathan makes one Slam attack.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 171, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 198

monster.name: Lonely Sorrowsworn
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Psychic Leech
trait.text: At the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

trait.name: Thrives on Company
trait.text: The sorrowsworn has advantage on attack rolls while it is within 30 feet of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sorrowsworn makes one Harpoon Arm attack, and it uses Sorrowful Embrace.

action.name: Harpoon Arm
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
The sorrowsworn has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.

action.name: Sorrowful Embrace
action.text: Each creature grappled by the sorrowsworn must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the sorrowsworn pulls each of those creatures up to 30 feet straight toward it.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 223, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 232

monster.name: Lost Sorrowsworn
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sorrowsworn makes two Arm Spike attacks.

action.name: Arm Spike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Embrace (Recharge 4-6)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.
Until the grapple ends, the target is frightened, and it takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The sorrowsworn can grapple only one creature at a time.

reaction.name: Tightening Embrace
reaction.text: If the sorrowsworn takes damage, the creature grappled by Embrace takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 224, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 233

monster.name: Male Steeder

trait.name: Extraordinary Leap
trait.text: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump 3 feet.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Sticky Leg
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. Hit: The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape DC 12). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 231, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 238, Out of the Abyss p. 231

monster.name: Martial Arts Adept

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 3. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 172, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 216

monster.name: Marut
monster.resist: thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The marut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the marut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The marut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The marut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The marut makes two Unerring Slam attacks.

action.name: Unerring Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 60 force damage, and the target is pushed up to 5 feet away from the marut if it is Huge or smaller.

action.name: Blazing Edict (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Arcane energy emanates from the marut's chest in a 60-foot cube. Every creature in that area takes 45 radiant damage. Each creature that takes any of this damage must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the marut's next turn.

action.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
action.text: The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 173, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 213

monster.name: Master Thief
monster.skill: Acrobatics +7, Athletics +3, Perception +3, Sleight Of Hand +7, Stealth +7
monster.languages: any one language (usually Common) plus thieves' cant

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided the thief isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thief makes three Shortsword or Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The thief takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The thief halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The thief must be able to see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 174, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 216

monster.name: Maurezhi
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Assume Form
trait.text: The maurezhi can assume the appearance of any Medium Humanoid it eats. It remains in this form for 1d6 days, during which time the form gradually decays until, when the effect ends, the form sloughs from the demon's body.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The maurezhi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The maurezhi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0. It rises 24 hours later as a ghoul unless it has been revived or its corpse has been destroyed.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Raise Ghoul (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The maurezhi targets one dead ghoul or ghast it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 175, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 133

monster.name: Maw Demon
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Disgorge (Recharge 6)
action.text: The demon vomits in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or take 11 (2d10) acid damage and fall prone in the spew.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 176, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 137

monster.name: Meazel

action.name: Garrote
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target of the meazel's size or smaller. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13 with disadvantage).
Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the meazel's turns. The meazel can't make weapon attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The meazel, any equipment it is wearing or carrying, and any creature it is grappling teleport to an unoccupied space within 500 feet of it, provided that the starting space and the destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination must be a place the meazel has seen before, but it need not be within line of sight. If the destination space is occupied, the teleportation leads to the nearest unoccupied space. Any other creature the meazel teleports becomes cursed for 1 hour or until the curse is ended by remove curse or greater restoration. Until this curse ends, every Undead and every creature native to the Shadowfell within 300 feet of the cursed creature can sense it, which prevents that creature from hiding from them.

action.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the meazel takes the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 177, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 214

monster.name: Meenlock

trait.name: Fear Aura
trait.text: Any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within 10 feet of the meenlock must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
trait.text: While in bright light, the meenlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Claw
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The meenlock teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it's teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination need not be within line of sight.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 178, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 170

monster.name: Merregon
monster.languages: understands Infernal but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the merregon's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The merregon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The merregon makes three Halberd attacks.

action.name: Halberd
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Loyal Bodyguard
reaction.text: When another Fiend within 5 feet of the merregon is hit by an attack roll, the merregon causes itself to be hit instead.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 179, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 166

monster.name: Merrenoloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The merrenoloth makes one Oar attack and uses Fear Gaze.

action.name: Oar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) fire damage.

action.name: Fear Gaze
action.text: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the merrenoloth for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The merrenoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: charm person, darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, gust of wind • 3/Day: control water

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties) while captaining a vessel, the merrenoloth can take one of the following lair actions; it can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Gale: The air within 60 feet of the vessel is filled with wind. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, that area is difficult terrain, and when a Medium or smaller creature flies into that area or starts its turn flying there, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Propel: A strong wind propels the vessel, increasing its speed by 30 feet until initiative count 20 on the next round.
Repair: The vessel regains 22 (4d10) hit points.

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The merrenoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: charm person, darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, gust of wind, control water
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 180, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 250

monster.name: Mindwitness

trait.name: Telepathic Hub
trait.text: When the mindwitness receives a telepathic message, it can telepathically share that message with up to seven other creatures within 600 feet of it that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mindwitness makes one Bite attack and one Tentacles attack, or it uses Eye Ray three times.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 20 (4d8 + 2) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13), and it must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or be restrained until this grapple ends.

action.name: Eye Ray
action.text:
The mindwitness shoots one magical eye ray at random (roll a d6, and reroll if the ray has already been used this turn), choosing one target it can see within 120 feet of it:
1: Aversion Ray The targeted creature must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 2: Fear Ray The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 3: Psychic Ray The target must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or take T1 (6d8) psychic damage. 4: Slowing Ray The targeted creature must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 5: Stunning Ray The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 6: Telekinetic Ray If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the mindwitness moves it up to 30 feet in any direction, and it is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the mindwitness's next turn or until the mindwitness is incapacitated. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The mindwitness can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 181, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 176

monster.name: Moloch
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Moloch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Moloch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Moloch regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Moloch dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Moloch makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Many-Tailed Whip attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage.

action.name: Many-Tailed Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d4 + 8) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet in a straight line toward Moloch.

action.name: Breath of Despair (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Moloch exhales in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage, drop whatever it is holding, and become frightened of Moloch for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from Moloch by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to Moloch, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Moloch casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21):
• At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), confusion, detect magic, fly, major image, stinking cloud, suggestion, wall of fire

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Moloch teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Moloch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Moloch regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Moloch makes one Bite, Claw, or Many-Tailed Whip attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Moloch uses Teleport.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Moloch uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: alter self, confusion, detect magic, fly, major image, stinking cloud, suggestion, wall of fire
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 183, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 177

monster.name: Molydeus
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the molydeus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The molydeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The molydeus makes one Demonic Weapon attack, one Snakebite attack, and one Wolf Bite attack.

action.name: Demonic Weapon
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) force damage. If the target has at least one head and the molydeus rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 27 (6d8) force damage from the hit.

action.name: Snakebite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target transforms into a manes if this reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This transformation can be ended only by a wish spell.

action.name: Wolf Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The molydeus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22):
• At will: dispel magic, polymorph, telekinesis, teleport • 3/Day: lightning bolt

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The molydeus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The molydeus regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The molydeus makes one Demonic Weapon or Snakebite attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The molydeus moves without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The molydeus uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: dispel magic, polymorph, telekinesis, teleport, lightning bolt
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 184, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 134

monster.name: Morkoth

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The morkoth can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The morkoth makes either two Bite attacks and one Tentacles attack or three Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the morkoth can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Hypnosis
action.text: The morkoth projects a 30-foot cone of magical energy. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the morkoth for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target tries to get as close to the morkoth as possible, using its actions to Dash until it is within 5 feet of the morkoth. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the morkoth's Hypnosis for 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The morkoth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: detect magic, mage hand • 3/Day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, lightning bolt, sending

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the morkoth can take one of the following lair actions:
Cast a Spell: The morkoth casts darkness, dispel magic, or misty step, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability and without expending a spell slot.
Hypnotize: The morkoth uses its Hypnosis action, originating at a point within 120 feet of itself. It doesn't need to see the effect's point of origin.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
reaction.text: If the morkoth makes a successful saving throw against a spell or a spell attack misses it, the morkoth can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 120 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the morkoth. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

monster.spells: detect magic, mage hand, darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, lightning bolt, sending
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 186, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 177

monster.name: Mouth Of Grolantor

trait.name: Mouth of Chaos
trait.text:
The giant is immune to the confusion spell.
On each of its turns, the giant uses all its movement to move toward the nearest creature or whatever else it might perceive as food. Roll a d10 at the start of each of the giant's turns to determine its action for that turn:
Mouth of Chaos: d10 | Action 1-3 | The giant makes three Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. 4-5 | The giant makes one Fist attack against each creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant makes one Fist attack against itself. 6-7 | The giant makes one Bite attack against one random creature within reach. If no other creatures are within reach, its eyes glaze over and it is stunned until the start of its next turn. 8-10 | The giant makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 187, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 149

monster.name: Nabassu
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Demonic Shadows
trait.text: The nabassu darkens the area around its body in a 10-foot radius. Nonmagical light can't illuminate this area of dim light.

trait.name: Devour Soul
trait.text: A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a Construct nor an Undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within 5 feet of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature's number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu's hit points by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The nabassu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nabassu makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it uses Soul-Stealing Gaze.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 38 (5d12 + 6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) force damage.

action.name: Soul-Stealing Gaze
action.text: The nabassu targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or take 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the nabassu regains hit points equal to half that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, and if the target is a Humanoid, it immediately rises as a ghoul under the nabassu's control.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 188, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 135

monster.name: Nagpa
monster.languages: Common plus up to five other languages

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nagpa makes three Staff or Deathly Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Deathly Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (7d6 + 6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The nagpa casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: detect magic, mage hand, message, minor illusion • 2/Day each: fireball, fly, hold person, suggestion, wall of fire • 1/Day each: dominate person, etherealness, feeblemind

action.name: Corruption (Bonus Action)
action.text: The nagpa targets one creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. An evil creature makes the save with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the nagpa until the start of the nagpa's next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to the nagpa's Corruption for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Paralysis (Recharge 6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The nagpa forces each creature within 30 feet of it to make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw, excludingUndead and Constructs. On a failed save, a target is paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: detect magic, mage hand, message, minor illusion, fireball, fly, hold person, suggestion, wall of fire, dominate person, etherealness, feeblemind
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 189, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 215

monster.name: Narzugon
monster.resist: acid, cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Infernal Tack
trait.text: The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The narzugon makes three Hellfire Lance attacks. It also uses Infernal Command or Terrifying Command.

action.name: Hellfire Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature with a soul, the soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

action.name: Infernal Command
action.text: Each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

action.name: Terrifying Command
action.text: Each creature within 60 feet of the narzugon that isn't a Fiend must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon's Terrifying Command for 24 hours.

action.name: Healing (1/Day)
action.text: The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hit points.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 190, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 167

monster.name: Necromancer Wizard
monster.resist: necrotic

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web • 1/Day: circle of death

action.name: Summon Undead (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The necromancer magically summons five skeletons or zombies. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
reaction.text: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web, circle of death
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 264, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 217

monster.name: Neogi

trait.name: Mental Fortitude
trait.text: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.
A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 192, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 180

monster.name: Neogi Hatchling

trait.name: Mental Fortitude
trait.text: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.
A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 191, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 179

monster.name: Neogi Master
monster.languages: Common, Deep Speech, Undercommon, telepathy 30 ft.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

trait.name: Mental Fortitude
trait.text: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The neogi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, or it makes two Tentacle of Hadar attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.
A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle of Hadar
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the neogi's next turn, as a spectral tentacle clings to the target.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: dimension door, hold person, hunger of Hadar

action.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, dimension door, hold person, hunger of Hadar
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 192, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 180

monster.name: Neothelid

trait.name: Creature Sense
trait.text: The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The neothelid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the neothelid. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neothelid, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the neothelid's turns. If the neothelid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the neothelid must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the neothelid. If the neothelid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The neothelid exhales acid in a 60- foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: levitate • 1/Day each: confusion, feeblemind, telekinesis

monster.spells: levitate, confusion, feeblemind, telekinesis
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 193, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 181

monster.name: Nightwalker
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Annihilating Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

trait.name: Life Eater
trait.text: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

action.name: Enervating Focus
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
action.text: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 194, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 216

monster.name: Nilbog

trait.name: Nilbogism
trait.text:
Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.
The nilbog can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through its Reversal of Fortune reaction.

action.name: Fool's Scepter
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mocking Word
action.text: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: mage hand, Tasha's hideous laughter

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The nilbog takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reaction.name: Reversal of Fortune
reaction.text: In response to another creature dealing damage to the nilbog, the nilbog reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.

monster.spells: mage hand, Tasha's hideous laughter
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 195, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 182

monster.name: Nupperibo
monster.resist: acid, cold

trait.name: Cloud of Vermin
trait.text: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 20 feet of one or more nupperibos must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) acid damage. A creature within the areas of two or more nupperibos makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

trait.name: Driven Tracker
trait.text: In the Nine Hells, the nupperibo can flawlessly track any creature that has taken damage from any nupperibo's Cloud of Vermin within the previous 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 196, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 168

monster.name: Oblex Spawn (MPMM)

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
trait.text: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1 d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1 d4) psychic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 197, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 217

monster.name: Ogre Battering Ram

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ogre makes two Bash attacks.

action.name: Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the ogre can push the target 5 feet away if the target is Huge or smaller.

reaction.name: Block the Path
reaction.text: When a creature enters a space within 5 feet of the ogre, the ogre makes a Bash attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 200, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 220

monster.name: Ogre Bolt Launcher

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bolt Launcher
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d10 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 200, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 220

monster.name: Ogre Chain Brute

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chain Smash (Recharge 6)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute.
The target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Chain Sweep
action.text: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw.
