On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 201, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 221

monster.name: Ogre Howdah

trait.name: Howdah
trait.text: The ogre carries a compact fort on its back. Up to four Small creatures can ride in the fort without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the ogre, they must use spears or weapons with reach. Creatures in the fort have three-quarters cover against attacks and effects from outside it. If the ogre dies, creatures in the fort are placed in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the ogre.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 201, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 221

monster.name: Oinoloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The oinoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oinoloth makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Corrupted Healing (Recharge 6)
action.text: The oinoloth touches one willing creature within 5 feet of it. The target regains all its hit points. In addition, the oinoloth can end one disease on the target or remove one of the following conditions from it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The target then gains 1 level of exhaustion, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6). This reduction can be removed only by a wish spell or by casting greater restoration on the target three times within the same hour. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The oinoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only) • 1/Day each: feeblemind, globe of invulnerability

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The oinoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Bringer of Plagues (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The oinoloth blights the area in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. The blight lasts for 24 hours. While the area is blighted, all normal plants there wither and die. Furthermore, when a creature moves into the blighted area or starts its turn there, that creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the oinoloth's Bringer of Plagues for the next 24 hours.
The poisoned creature can't regain hit points. After every 24 hours that elapse, the poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). This reduction lasts until the poison ends, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. The poison ends after the creature successfully saves against it three times.

monster.spells: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, hold monster, invisibility, feeblemind, globe of invulnerability
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 202, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 251

monster.name: Orcus
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Master of Undeath
trait.text: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/Day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

action.name: Wand of Orcus
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

action.name: Necrotic Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

action.name: Conjure Undead (1/Day)
action.text: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures Undead creatures whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):
• At will: detect magic • 3/Day: dispel magic • 1/Day: time stop

action.name: Wand Spellcasting
action.text:
While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save DC 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:
• At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead • 2 charges: power word kill • 1 charge each: circle of death, finger of death

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Orcus can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; he can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:
Deadly Utterance. Orcus's voice booms throughout the lair. His utterance causes one creature of his choice to be subjected to power word kill. Orcus needn't see the creature, but he must be aware that the individual is in the lair. Grasp of the Dead. Orcus causes skeletal arms to rise from an area on the ground in a 20-foot square that he can see. They last until the next initiative count 20. Each creature in that area when the arms appear must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be restrained until the arms disappear or until Orcus releases them (no action required). Undead Servants. Orcus causes up to six corpses within the lair to rise as skeletons, zombies, or ghouls. These undead obey his telepathic commands, which can reach anywhere in the lair.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Orcus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Orcus regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Orcus makes one Tail or Necrotic Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcus's next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

monster.spells: create undead, detect magic, dispel magic, time stop, animate dead, blight, speak with dead, power word kill, circle of death, finger of death
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 204, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 153

monster.name: Orthon
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Infernal Dagger
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d4 + 6) force damage, and the target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Brass Crossbow
action.text:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:
Acid: The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an additional 17 (5d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Blindness: The target takes 5 (1d10) radiant damage. In addition, the target and all other creatures within 20 feet of it must each make a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the orthon's next turn.
Concussion: The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 (2d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Entanglement: The target must make a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 hour by strands of sticky webbing. The target can escape by taking an action to make a DC DC 17 Strength or Dexterity check and succeeding.
Paralysis: The target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage and must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Tracking: For the next 24 hours, the orthon knows the direction and distance to the target, as long as it's on the same plane of existence. If the target is on a different plane, the orthon knows which one, but not the exact location there.

action.name: Invisibility Field (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The orthon becomes invisible. Any equipment it wears or carries is also invisible as long as the equipment is on its person. This invisibility ends immediately after it makes an attack roll or is hit by an attack roll.

reaction.name: Explosive Retribution
reaction.text: In response to dropping to 15 hit points or fewer, the orthon explodes. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must each make a DC DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orthon, its infernal dagger, and its brass crossbow are destroyed.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 205, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 169

monster.name: Ox

trait.name: Beast of Burden
trait.text: The ox is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the ox moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 72, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Phoenix
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
trait.text:
If the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature in 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the phoenix must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
The explosion destroys the phoenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals 21 (6d6) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

trait.name: Fire Form
trait.text: The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The phoenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The phoenix deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The phoenix makes two attacks: one Beak attack and one Fiery Talons attack.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) fire damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The phoenix can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The phoenix regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Peck
legendary.text: The phoenix makes one beak attack.

legendary.name: Swoop (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The phoenix moves up to its speed and makes on Fiery Talons attack.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 206, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 199

monster.name: Quetzalcoatlus

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The quetzalcoatlus doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the quetzalcoatlus flew least 30 feet toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 96, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 140

monster.name: Quickling
monster.skill: Acrobatics +8, Perception +5, Sleight Of Hand +8, Stealth +8

trait.name: Blurred Movement
trait.text: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless it is incapacitated or its speed is 0.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The quickling makes three Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 207, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 187

monster.name: Red Abishai
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abishai makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it can use Frightful Presence or Incite Fanaticism.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 38 (7d10) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the abishai's choice that is within 120 feet and aware of the abishai must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abishai's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Incite Fanaticism
action.text: The abishai chooses up to four other creatures within 60 feet of it that can see it. Until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with advantage and can't be frightened.

action.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
action.text: The abishai targets one Dragon it can see within 120 feet of it. The Dragon must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. A chromatic dragon makes this save with disadvantage. On a successful save, the target is immune to the abishai's Power of the Dragon Queen for 1 hour. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. This effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 40, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 160

monster.name: Redcap

trait.name: Iron Boots
trait.text: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Outsize Strength
trait.text: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The redcap makes three Wicked Sickle attacks.

action.name: Wicked Sickle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Ironbound Pursuit
action.text: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 208, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 188

monster.name: Retriever
monster.languages: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can't speak
monster.immune: necrotic, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
trait.text: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses Force Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

action.name: Foreleg
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Force Beam
action.text: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The retriever casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• 3/Day each: plane shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature, which is considered willing for the spell), web

monster.spells: plane shift, web
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 209, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 222

monster.name: Rot Troll

trait.name: Rancid Degeneration
trait.text: At the end of each of the troll's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, unless the troll has taken acid or fire damage since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 247, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 244

monster.name: Rutterkin
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

trait.name: Immobilizing Fear
trait.text: When a creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more rutterkins, that creature must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. The creature has disadvantage on the save if it's within 30 feet of six or more rutterkins. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the rutterkins for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is restrained. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rutterkins for 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned. At the end of each long rest, the poisoned target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while poisoned in this way, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes. The transformation can be undone only by a wish spell.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 210, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 136

monster.name: Sea Spawn
monster.languages: understands Aquan and Common but can't speak

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
trait.text: The sea spawn can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged in the sea at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sea spawn makes two Unarmed Strike attacks and one Piscine Anatomy attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Piscine Anatomy
action.text:
The sea spawn uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):
Piscine Anatomy: d6 | Attack 1-2 | Bite Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. 3-4 | Poison Quills Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 5-6 | Tentacle Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the sea spawn can't use this tentacle on another target.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 211, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 189

monster.name: Shadar-kai Gloom Weaver

trait.name: Burden of Time
trait.text: Beasts and Humanoids (except elves) have disadvantage on saving throws while within 10 feet of the shadar-kai.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadar-kai makes three Shadow Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Shadow Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 26 (4d12) necrotic damage. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: arcane eye, mage armor, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with dead • 1/Day each: arcane gate, bane, confusion, darkness, fear, major image, true seeing

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharge 6)
reaction.text: When the shadar-kai takes damage, it turns invisible and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks or casts a spell.

monster.spells: arcane eye, mage armor, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with dead, arcane gate, bane, confusion, darkness, fear, major image, true seeing
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 213, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 224

monster.name: Shadar-kai Shadow Dancer
monster.resist: necrotic

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadar-kai makes three Spiked Chain attacks. It can use Shadow Jump after one of these attacks.

action.name: Spiked Chain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):
Spiked Chain Effects: d6 | Effect 1-2 | Decay: The target takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage. 3-4 | Grapple: The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the shadar-kai can't grapple another target. 5-6 | Topple: The target is knocked prone.

action.name: Shadow Jump (Bonus Action)
action.text: The shadar-kai teleports, along with any equipment is it wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the space it teleports to must be in dim light or darkness.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 213, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 225

monster.name: Shadar-kai Soul Monger

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Soul Thirst
trait.text: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the shadar-kai can gain temporary hit points equal to half the creature's hit point maximum. While the shadar-kai has temporary hit points from this trait, it has advantage on attack rolls.

trait.name: Weight of Ages
trait.text: Any Beast or Humanoid (except an elf) that starts its turn within 5 feet of the shadar-kai has its speed reduced by 20 feet until the start of that creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadar-kai makes two Shadow Dagger attacks.

action.name: Shadow Dagger
action.text:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws until the end of the shadar-kai's next turn.
Hit or Miss: The dagger magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• 1/Day each: bestow curse, finger of death, gaseous form, seeming

action.name: Wave of Weariness (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: The shadar-kai emits weariness in a 60-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and suffers 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and doesn't gain a level of exhaustion.

monster.spells: bestow curse, finger of death, gaseous form, seeming
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 214, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 226

monster.name: Shadow Mastiff
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Ethereal Awareness
trait.text: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Terrifying Howl (Recharge 6)
action.text: The shadow mastiff howls. Any Beast or Humanoid within 300 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any shadow mastiff's Terrifying Howl for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Shadow Blend (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 215, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 190

monster.name: Shadow Mastiff Alpha
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Ethereal Awareness
trait.text: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Shadow Blend (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 215, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 190

monster.name: Shoosuva
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shoosuva makes one Bite attack and one Tail Stinger attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Stinger
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned.
While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rampage (Bonus Action)
action.text: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the shoosuva can move up to half its speed and make one Bite attack.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 216, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 137

monster.name: Sibriex
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Contamination
trait.text: The sibriex emits an aura of corruption 30 feet in every direction. Vegetation withers in the aura, and the ground in the aura is difficult terrain for other creatures. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this sibriex's Contamination for 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the sibriex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sibriex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sibriex makes three Chain attacks, and it uses Squirt Bile.

action.name: Chain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d12 + 7) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The sibriex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21):
• At will: command, dispel magic, hold monster • 1/Day: feeblemind

action.name: Squirt Bile
action.text: The sibriex targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 31 (9d6) acid damage.

action.name: Warp Creature
action.text: The sibriex targets up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, a creature becomes immune to this sibriex's Warp Creature. On a failed save, the target is poisoned, which causes it to also gain 1 level of exhaustion. While poisoned in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it, and ending the poison removes any levels of exhaustion caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to gain another level of exhaustion. Once the target reaches 6 levels of exhaustion, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes under the sibriex's control. The transformation of the body can be undone only by a wish spell.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The sibriex can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The sibriex regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell
legendary.text: The sibriex uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Spray Bile
legendary.text: The sibriex uses Squirt Bile.

legendary.name: Warp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The sibriex uses Warp Creature.

monster.spells: dispel magic, hold monster, feeblemind
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 217, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 137

monster.name: Skulk

trait.name: Fallible Invisibility
trait.text:
The skulk is invisible. This invisibility can be circumvented by three things: Charnel Candles. The skulk appears as a dim, translucent form in the light of a candle made of fat rendered from a corpse whose identity is unknown.
Children: Humanoid children, aged 10 and under, can see through this invisibility. Reflective Surfaces. The skulk appears as a drab, smoothskinned biped if its reflection can be seen in a mirror or on another surface.

trait.name: Trackless
trait.text: The skulk leaves no tracks to indicate where it has been or where it's headed.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 219, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 227

monster.name: Skull Lord
monster.languages: all the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: cold, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, stunned, unconscious

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the skull lord is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the skull lord instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the skull lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Master of the Grave
trait.text: While within 30 feet of the skull lord, any Undead ally of the skull lord makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The skull lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skull lord makes three Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attacks.

action.name: Bone Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Deathly Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The skull, lord casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):
• At will: mage hand, message • 2/Day each: dimension door, fear • 1/Day each: cloudkill, cone of cold

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The skull lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The skull lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The skull lord makes one Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The skull lord moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Summon Undead (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The skull lord summons up to five skeletons or zombies in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. They remain until destroyed. Undead summoned in this way roll initiative, act in the next available turn, and obey the skull lord. The skull lord can have no more than five Undead summoned by this ability at a time.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, dimension door, fear, cloudkill, cone of cold
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 220, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 230

monster.name: Slithering Tracker
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., swim 30 ft.
monster.languages: understands languages it knew in its previous form but can't speak
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the slithering tracker is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the slithering tracker move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the slithering tracker isn't a puddle.

trait.name: Liquid Form
trait.text: The slithering tracker can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The slithering tracker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Life Leech
action.text:
One Large or smaller creature that the slithering tracker can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. In addition, the grappled target takes 16 (3d10) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The slithering tracker can grapple only one target at a time.
While grappling the target, the slithering tracker takes only half any damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the target takes the other half.

action.name: Watery Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: If underwater, the slithering tracker takes the Hide action, and it makes the Dexterity (Stealth) check with advantage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 221, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 191

monster.name: Spawn Of Kyuss
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The spawn of Kyuss regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or a body of running water. If the spawn takes acid, fire, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the spawn's next turn. The spawn is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The spawn of Kyuss requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Worms
trait.text: If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Burrowing Worm action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spawn of Kyuss makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Burrowing Worm.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Burrowing Worm
action.text: A worm launches from the spawn of Kyuss at one Humanoid that the spawn can see within 10 feet of it. The worm latches onto the target's skin unless the target succeeds on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw. The worm is a Tiny Undead with AC 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action (the spawn can use Burrowing Worm to launch a scraped-off worm at a Humanoid it can see within 10 feet of the worm). Otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of 1 Od6), and if it drops to 0 hit points, it dies and then rises 10 minutes later as a spawn of Kyuss. If a worm-infested target is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 225, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 192

monster.name: Spirit Troll
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The troll can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes psychic or force damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute.
The stunned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 247, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 244

monster.name: Spring Eladrin
monster.resist: psychic

trait.name: Joyful Presence
trait.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Joyful Presence for 24 hours. Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: Tasha's hideous laughter • 1/Day each: major image, suggestion

action.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: Tasha's hideous laughter, major image, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 116, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 196

monster.name: Star Spawn Grue

trait.name: Aura of Shrieks
trait.text: Creatures within 20 feet of the grue that aren't Aberrations have disadvantage on saving throws, as well as on attack rolls against creatures other than a star spawn grue.

action.name: Confounding Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of the grue's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 227, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 234

monster.name: Star Spawn Hulk
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Psychic Mirror
trait.text: If the hulk takes psychic damage, each creature within 10 feet of the hulk takes that damage instead; the hulk takes none of the damage. In addition, the hulk's thoughts and location can't be discerned by magic.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hulk makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target also takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the target's next turn.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reaping Arms (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The hulk makes a separate Slam attack against each creature within 10 feet of it. Each creature that is hit must also succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 227, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 234

monster.name: Star Spawn Larva Mage
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained

trait.name: Return to Worms
trait.text: When the mage is reduced to 0 hit points, it breaks apart into a swarm of insects in the same space. Unless the swarm is destroyed, the mage reforms from it 24 hours later.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mage makes three Slam or Eldritch Bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Eldritch Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Plague of Worms (Recharge 6)
action.text: Each creature other than a star spawn within 10 feet of the mage must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (5d8) necrotic damage and be blinded and restrained by masses of swarming worms. The affected creature takes 22 (5d8) necrotic damage at the start of each of the mage's turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The mage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: mage hand, message, minor illusion • 1/Day: dominate monster

reaction.name: Feed on Weakness
reaction.text: When a creature within 20 feet of the mage fails a saving throw, the mage gains 10 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions(3/Day)
legendary.text: The star spawn larva mage can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The star spawn larva mage regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Slam
legendary.text: The mage makes one Slam attack.

legendary.name: Eldritch Bolt (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The mage makes one Eldritch Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Feed (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Each creature restrained by the mage's Plague of Worms takes 13 (3d8) necrotic damage, and the mage gains 6 temporary hit points.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, minor illusion, dominate monster
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 228, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 235

monster.name: Star Spawn Mangler
monster.resist: cold

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: The mangier has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mangier makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage. If the attack roll has advantage, the target also takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Flurry of Claws (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The mangier makes six Claw attacks. Either before or after these attacks, it can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
action.text: While in dim light or darkness, the mangier takes the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 229, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 236

monster.name: Star Spawn Seer
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Out-Of-Phase Movement
trait.text:
The seer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, and its movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. Each creature it moves through takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn.
The seer takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The seer makes two Comet Staff or Psychic Orb attacks.

action.name: Comet Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Psychic Orb
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 feet, one creature. Hit: 27 (5d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Collapse Distance (Recharge 6)
action.text: The seer warps space around one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is teleported up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the seer can see, and then each creature within 10 feet of the target's original space takes 39 (6d12) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage and isn't teleported.

reaction.name: Bend Space
reaction.text: When the seer would be hit by an attack roll, it teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, exchanging positions with another star spawn it can see within 60 feet of it. The other star spawn is hit by the attack instead.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 230, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 236

monster.name: Steel Predator
monster.languages: understands Modron and the language of its owner but can't speak
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic, thunder
monster.immune: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The steel predator has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The steel predator doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The steel predator makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The steel predator casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:
• 3/Day each: dimension door (self only), plane shift (self only)

action.name: Stunning Roar (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The steel predator emits a roar in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) thunder damage, drops everything it's holding, and is stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

monster.spells: dimension door, plane shift
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 232, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 239

monster.name: Stegosaurus

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 96, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 140

monster.name: Stench Kow
monster.resist: cold, fire, poison

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a stench kow that starts its turn within 5 feet of the stench kow must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all stench kows for 1 hour.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the stench kow moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 72, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Stone Cursed
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Cunning Opportunist
trait.text: The stone cursed has advantage on the attack rolls of opportunity attacks.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the stone cursed is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the stone cursed move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the stone cursed isn't a statue.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The stone cursed doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Petrifying Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, or it begins to turn to stone and is restrained until the end of its next turn, when it must repeat the saving throw. The effect ends if the second save is successful; otherwise the target is petrified for 24 hours.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 233, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 240

monster.name: Stone Giant Dreamwalker

trait.name: Dreamwalker's Charm
trait.text: An enemy that starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, provided that the giant isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the giant. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, the creature is immune to this giant's Dreamwalker's Charm for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Petrifying Touch
action.text: The giant touches one Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of it that is charmed by it. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes petrified, and the giant can adhere the target to its stony body. greater restoration spells and other magic that can undo petrification have no effect on a petrified creature adhered to the giant unless the giant is dead, in which case the magic works normally, freeing the petrified creature as well as ending the petrified condition on it.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 234, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 150

monster.name: Storm Giant Quintessent
monster.speed: walk 50 ft., fly 50 ft. (hover), swim 50 ft.
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The giant can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks, or it uses Wind Javelin twice.

action.name: Lightning Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 40 (9d6 + 9) lightning damage.

action.name: Wind Javelin
action.text: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin deals 19 (3d6 + 9) force damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
A storm giant quintessent can use lair actions in giant form and while transformed into a storm. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the giant can take one of the following lair actions; the giant can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Deafening Boom: The giant creates a thunderclap centered on a point anywhere in their lair. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be deafened until the end of its next turn.
Fog: The giant creates a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog (or murky water if within water) centered on a point anywhere in its lair. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The fog lasts until the giant disperses it (no action required), and it can't be dispersed by wind.
Gale: The giant creates a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line of strong wind (or strong current within water) originating from a point anywhere in its lair. Each creature in that line must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in the direction the wind is blowing. The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in its area. Protected flames, such as those of lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The storm giant quintessent can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The storm giant quintessent regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Gust
legendary.text: The giant targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around the target, who must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the giant chooses.

legendary.name: Thunderbolt (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The giant hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: One with the Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The giant vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The giant can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a giant once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the giant can't take any actions other than lair actions, and it can't be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The giant can't use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 235, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 151

monster.name: Summer Eladrin
monster.resist: fire

trait.name: Fearsome Presence
trait.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the eladrin for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

action.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The eladrin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the eladrin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 116, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 196

monster.name: Swarm Of Cranium Rats
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Telepathic Shroud
trait.text: The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
As long as it has more than half of its hit points remaining, the swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: command, comprehend languages, detect thoughts • 1/Day each: confusion, dominate monster

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The swarm sheds dim light from its brains in a 5-foot radius, increases the illumination to bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius (and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius), or extinguishes the light.

monster.spells: command, comprehend languages, detect thoughts, confusion, dominate monster
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 83, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 133

monster.name: Swarm Of Rot Grubs
monster.resist: piercing, slashing
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned.
At the end of each of the poisoned target's turns, the target takes 3 (1d6) poison damage. Whenever the poisoned target takes fire damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the poisoned target ends its turn with 0 hit points, it dies.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 237, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 208

monster.name: Swashbuckler

trait.name: Suave Defense
trait.text: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The swashbuckler makes one Dagger attack and two Rapier attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightfooted (Bonus Action)
action.text: The swashbuckler takes the Dash or Disengage action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 238, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 217

monster.name: Sword Wraith Commander
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Turning Defiance
trait.text: The commander and any other sword wraiths within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The commander doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The commander makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Call to Honor (1/Day)
action.text: If the commander has taken damage during this combat, it gives itself advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn, and 1d4 + 1 sword wraith warriors appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. The warriors last until they drop to 0 hit points, and they take their turns immediately after the commander's turn on the same initiative count.

action.name: Martial Fury (Bonus Action)
action.text: The commander makes one Longsword or Longbow attack, which deals an extra 9 (2d8) necrotic damage on a hit, and attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 239, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 241

monster.name: Sword Wraith Warrior
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The warrior doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Martial Fury (Bonus Action)
action.text: The warrior makes one Battleaxe or Longbow attack, and attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 239, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 241

monster.name: Tanarukk
monster.languages: Abyssal, Common, plus any one language
monster.resist: fire, poison

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The tanarukk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tanarukk makes one Bite attack and one Greatsword attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Aggressive (Bonus Action)
action.text: The tanarukk moves up to its speed toward an enemy that it can see.

reaction.name: Unbridled Fury
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the tanarukk can make one Bite or Greatsword attack with advantage against the attacker.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 240, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 186

monster.name: Thorny Vegepygmy
monster.resist: lightning, piercing

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The thorny has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The thorny regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the thorny's next turn. The thorny dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Thorny Body
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the thorny deals 2 (1d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 253, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 197

monster.name: Titivilus
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Titivilus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Titivilus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Titivilus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Titivilus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Ventriloquism
trait.text: Whenever Titivilus speaks, he can choose a point within 60 feet of him; his voice emanates from that point.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Titivilus makes one Silver Sword attack, and he uses Frightful Word.

action.name: Silver Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage if used with two hands, plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

action.name: Frightful Word
action.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the target must take the Dash action and move away from Titivilus by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Titivilus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21):
• At will: alter self, major image, nondetection, sending, suggestion • 3/Day each: mislead, modify memory

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Titivilus teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

action.name: Twisting Words
action.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Charisma saving throw or become charmed by Titivilus for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw if Titivilus deals any damage to it. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Titivilus's Twisting Words for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Titivilus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Titivilus regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Corrupting Guidance
legendary.text: Titivilus uses Twisting Words. Alternatively, he targets one creature charmed by him that is within 60 feet of him; that charmed target must succeed on a DC 21 Charisma saving throw, or Titivilus decides how the target acts during its next turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Titivilus uses Teleport.

legendary.name: Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Titivilus makes one Silver Sword attack, or he uses Frightful Word.

monster.spells: alter self, major image, nondetection, sending, suggestion, mislead, modify memory
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 242, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 179

monster.name: Tlincalli

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tlincalli makes one Longsword or Spiked Chain attack and one Sting attack.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Spiked Chain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tlincalli can't use the spiked chain against another target.

action.name: Sting
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.
If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 242, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 193

monster.name: Tortle

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands in melee.

action.name: Light Crossbow
