action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 80/320ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 244, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 242

monster.name: Tortle Druid

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tortle makes four Claw attacks or two Nature's Wrath attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Nature's Wrath
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) damage of a type chosen by the tortle: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The tortle casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: druidcraft, guidance • 2/Day each: cure wounds, hold person, speak with animals, thunderwave

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, cure wounds, hold person, speak with animals, thunderwave
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 244, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 242

monster.name: Transmuter Wizard

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The transmuter makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The transmuter casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: light, message, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: fireball, hold person, knock, mage armor, polymorph, slow • 1/Day: telekinesis

action.name: Transmute (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The transmuter casts alter self or changes the benefit of Transmuter's Stone if bearing the stone.

monster.spells: light, message, prestidigitation, fireball, hold person, knock, mage armor, polymorph, slow, telekinesis
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 265, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 218

monster.name: Trapper

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the trapper is motionless on a floor, wall, or ceiling at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the trapper move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the trapper isn't part of the floor, wall, or ceiling.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The trapper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Smother
action.text: One Large or smaller creature within 10 feet of the trapper must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 14). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. While grappled in this way, the target is restrained, blinded, and deprived of air. The trapper can smother only one creature at a time.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 245, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 194

monster.name: Ulitharid

trait.name: Creature Sense
trait.text: The ulitharid is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ulitharid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Hub
trait.text: If an elder brain establishes a psychic link with the ulitharid, the elder brain can form a psychic link with any other creature the ulitharid can detect using its Creature Sense. Any such link ends if the creature falls outside the telepathy ranges of both the ulitharid and the elder brain. The ulitharid can maintain its psychic link with the elder brain regardless of the distance between them, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence. If the ulitharid is more than 5 miles away from the elder brain, it can end the psychic link at any time (no action required).

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 14) and must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated Humanoid grappled by the ulitharid. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ulitharid kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The ulitharid magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or take 31 (4d12 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The ulitharid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: detect thoughts, levitate • 1/Day each: dominate monster, feeblemind, mass suggestion, plane shift (self only), project image, scrying, telekinesis

monster.spells: detect thoughts, levitate, dominate monster, feeblemind, mass suggestion, plane shift, project image, scrying, telekinesis
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 249, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 175

monster.name: Vampiric Mist
monster.resist: acid, cold, lightning, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Forbiddance
trait.text: The mist can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Life Sense
trait.text: The mist can sense the location of any creature within 60 feet of it, unless that creature's type is Construct or Undead.

trait.name: Misty Form
trait.text: The mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The mist can't manipulate objects in any way that requires fingers or manual dexterity.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The mist takes 10 radiant damage whenever it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The mist doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: The mist touches one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw (Undead and Constructs automatically succeed), or it takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, the mist regains 10 hit points, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 250, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 246

monster.name: Vargouille
monster.languages: understands Abyssal, Infernal, and any languages it knew before becoming a vargouille but can't speak
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Abyssal Curse
action.text: The vargouille targets one incapacitated Humanoid within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target loses 1 point of Charisma after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell; don't count that time. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, it dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete can end the curse. Doing so undoes the changes made to the target by the curse.

action.name: Stunning Shriek (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The vargouille shrieks. Each Humanoid and Beast within 30 feet of the vargouille and able to hear it must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the vargouille until the end of the vargouille's next turn. While frightened in this way, a target is stunned. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Stunning Shriek of all vargouilles for 1 hour.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 251, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 195

monster.name: Vegepygmy
monster.resist: lightning, piercing

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vegepygmy regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 252, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 196

monster.name: Vegepygmy Chief
monster.resist: lightning, piercing

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vegepygmy regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vegepygmy makes two Claw attacks or two melee Spear attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vegepygmy. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area that isn't a Plant must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 9 (2d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 253, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 197

monster.name: Velociraptor

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The velociraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the velociraptor's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The velociraptor makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 96, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 140

monster.name: Venom Troll

trait.name: Poison Splash
trait.text: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the creature is poisoned until the start of the troll's next turn.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Venom Spray (Recharge 6)
action.text: The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a 15-foot cube. The troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). Each creature in the area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 248, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 245

monster.name: War Priest

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The war priest makes two Maul attacks, and it uses Holy Fire.

action.name: Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus Hit: 10 (3d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Holy Fire
action.text: The war priest targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and it is blinded until the start of the war priest's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The war priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: light, spare the dying, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: banishment, command, dispel magic, flame strike, guardian of faith, hold person, lesser restoration, revivify

action.name: Healing Light (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The war priest or one creature of its choice within 60 feet of it regains 12 (2d8 + 3) hit points.

monster.spells: light, spare the dying, thaumaturgy, banishment, command, dispel magic, flame strike, guardian of faith, hold person, lesser restoration, revivify
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 254, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 218

monster.name: Warlock Of The Archfey

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warlock makes two Rapier attacks, or it uses Bewildering Word twice.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

action.name: Bewildering Word
action.text: The warlock utters a magical bewilderment, targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 9 (2d8) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the warlock's next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: dancing lights, disguise self, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with animals • 1/Day each: charm person, dimension door, hold monster

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: In response to taking damage, the warlock turns invisible and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

monster.spells: dancing lights, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with animals, charm person, dimension door, hold monster
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 255, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 219

monster.name: Warlock Of The Fiend
monster.languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)
monster.resist: fire

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warlock makes three Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

action.name: Hellfire
action.text: Green flame explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the warlock. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage and 11 (2d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: alter self, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: banishment, plane shift, suggestion

reaction.name: Fiendish Rebuke (3/Day)
reaction.text: In response to being damaged by a visible creature within 60 feet of it, the warlock forces that creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: alter self, mage armor, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, banishment, plane shift, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 255, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 219

monster.name: Warlock Of The Great Old One
monster.sortname: Warlock, Of The Great Old One
monster.resist: psychic

trait.name: Whispering Aura
trait.text: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warlock makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Howling Void
action.text: The warlock opens a momentary extraplanar rift within 60 feet of it. The rift is a scream-filled, 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is frightened of the warlock until the start of the war lock's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect magic, guidance, levitate, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: arcane gate, detect thoughts, true seeing

monster.spells: detect magic, guidance, levitate, mage armor, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, arcane gate, detect thoughts, true seeing
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 256, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 220

monster.name: Warlord

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
trait.text: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Survivor
trait.text: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fewer than half its hit points but at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warlord makes two Greatsword or Short bow attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The warlord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The warlord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Command Ally
legendary.text: The warlord targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. if the target can see and hear the warlord, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
legendary.text: The warlord makes one Greatsword or Shortbow attack.

legendary.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The warlord targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of warlord's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 257, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 220

monster.name: Wastrilith
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Corrupt Water
trait.text: At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates. A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest. If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wastrilith makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it uses Grasping Spout.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Grasping Spout
action.text: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

action.name: Undertow (Bonus Action)
action.text: If the wastrilith is underwater, it causes all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 258, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 139

monster.name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
monster.languages: Aquan, one language of its creator's choice
monster.resist: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The myrmidon makes three Trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) force damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Freezing Strikes (Recharge 6)
action.text: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 123, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 203

monster.name: White Abishai
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the abishai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abishai makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Longsword attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Vicious Reprisal
reaction.text: In response to taking damage, the abishai makes one Bite attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the abishai moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 41, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 163

monster.name: Winter Eladrin
monster.resist: cold

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sorrowful Presence
trait.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours. Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: fog cloud, gust of wind, sleet storm

action.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Frigid Rebuke
reaction.text: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 (2d10) cold damage.

monster.spells: fog cloud, gust of wind, sleet storm
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 117, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 197

monster.name: Wood Woad
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tree Stride
trait.text: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wood woad makes two Club attacks.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. +14 (4d4 + 4) force damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 266, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 198

monster.name: Wretched Sorrowsworn
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Wretched Pack Tactics
trait.text: The sorrowsworn has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sorrowsworn's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. The sorrowsworn otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage, and the sorrowsworn attaches to the target.
While attached, the sorrowsworn can't attack, and at the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, the target takes 6 (1d10 + 1) necrotic damage. The attached sorrowsworn moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the sorrowsworn's movement. The sorrowsworn can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the sorrowsworn.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 224, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 233

monster.name: Xvart

trait.name: Raxivort's Tongue
trait.text: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target, the xvart can push the target 5 feet if the target is a Medium or smaller creature.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1 d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Low Cunning (Bonus Action)
action.text: The xvart takes the Disengage action.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 267, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 200

monster.name: Xvart Warlock Of Raxivort

trait.name: Raxivort's Blessing
trait.text: When the xvart reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the xvart gains 4 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Raxivort's Tongue
trait.text: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The xvart makes two Scimitar or Raxivort's Bite attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Raxivort's Bite
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range 30 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) poison damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The xvart casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11):
• At will: detect magic, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: burning hands, invisibility

action.name: Low Cunning (Bonus Action)
action.text: The xvart takes the Disengage action.

monster.spells: detect magic, mage armor, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, burning hands, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 267, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 200

monster.name: Yagnoloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yagnoloth makes one Electrified Touch attack and one Massive Arm attack, or it makes one Massive Arm attack and uses Battlefield Cunning, if available, or Teleport.

action.name: Electrified Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Massive Arm
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d12 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

action.name: Battlefield Cunning (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Up to two allied yugoloths within 60 feet of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

action.name: Life Leech
action.text:
The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within 15 feet of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The yagnoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), suggestion • 3/Day: lightning bolt

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The yagnoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.spells: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility, suggestion, lightning bolt
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 268, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 252

monster.name: Yeenoghu
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Yeenoghu makes three Flail attacks.

action.name: Flail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (2d12 + 9) force damage. If it's his turn, Yeenoghu can cause the target to suffer one of the following additional effects, each of which he can apply only once per turn. Confusion The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn. Force The target takes an extra 13 (2d12) force damage. Paralysis The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Yeenoghu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: detect magic • 3/Day each: dispel magic, fear, invisibility • 1/Day: teleport

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Yeenoghu can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Incite the Pack. Until the next initiative count 20, all gnolls and hyenas within the lair are enraged, causing them to have advantage on melee weapon attack rolls and causing attack rolls to have advantage against them. Iron Spike. Yeenoghu causes an iron spike—5 feet tall and 1 inch in diameter—to burst from the ground at a point he can see within 100 feet of him. Any creature in the space where the spike emerges must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 (6d8) piercing damage and is restrained by being impaled on the spike. A creature can use an action to remove itself (or a creature it can reach) from the spike, ending the restrained condition. Pack Rush. Each gnoll or hyena that Yeenoghu can see can use its reaction to move up to its speed.

action.name: Rampage (Bonus Action)
action.text: When Yeenoghu reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, he moves up to half his speed and makes one Bite attack.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Yeenoghu can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Yeenoghu regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Charge
legendary.text: Yeenoghu moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Swat Away
legendary.text: Yeenoghu makes one Flail attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line away from Yeenoghu. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked prone.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Yeenoghu makes a separate Bite attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, fear, invisibility, teleport
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 270, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 155

monster.name: Yeth Hound
monster.languages: understands Common, Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Sunlight Banishment
trait.text: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
trait.text: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

action.name: Baleful Baying
action.text: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 271, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 201

monster.name: Young Kruthik (MPMM)
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., burrow 10 ft., climb 30 ft.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2V2-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Stab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 168, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 211

monster.name: Yuan-ti Anathema
monster.speed: walk 40 ft., climb 40 ft., swim 40 ft.
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
trait.text: Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathama's aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Six Heads
trait.text: The anathema has advantage on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

action.name: Multiattack (Anathema Form Only)
action.text: The anathema makes two Claw attacks and one Flurry of Bites attack.

action.name: Claw (Anathema Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Flurry of Bites (Anathema Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict (Snake Form Only)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16).
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and it takes 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The anathema can constrict only one creature at a time.

action.name: Spellcasting (Anathema Form Only)
action.text:
The anathema casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: animal friendship (snakes only) • 3/Day each: darkness, entangle, fear, polymorph, suggestion

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The anathema transforms into a Huge constrictor snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

monster.spells: animal friendship, darkness, entangle, fear, polymorph, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 272, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 202

monster.name: Yuan-ti Broodguard

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the broodguard can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The broodguard makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 273, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 203

monster.name: Yuan-ti Mind Whisperer

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sseth's Blessing
trait.text: When the yuan-ti reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the yuan-ti gains 9 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yuan-ti makes two Bite attacks and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Spectral Fangs
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text:
The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: animal friendship (snakes only), message, minor illusion, prestidigitation • 3/Day: suggestion
• 2/Day each: detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

monster.spells: animal friendship, message, minor illusion, prestidigitation, suggestion, detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 274, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 204

monster.name: Yuan-ti Nightmare Speaker

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yuan-ti makes one Constrict attack and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

action.name: Constrict
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature.
Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The yuan-ti can constrict only one creature at a time.

action.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Spectral Fangs
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text:
The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature.
The target must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

action.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text:
The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: animal friendship (snakes only), mage hand, message, prestidigitation • 3/Day: suggestion
• 2/Day each: darkness, fear

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

monster.spells: animal friendship, mage hand, message, prestidigitation, suggestion, darkness, fear
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 275, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 205

monster.name: Yuan-ti Pit Master

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yuan-ti makes three Bite attacks or two Spectral Fangs attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Spectral Fangs
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) poison damage.

action.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.

action.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text:
The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: animal friendship (snakes only), guidance, mage hand, message • 3/Day: suggestion
• 2/Day each: hold person, invisibility

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

monster.spells: animal friendship, guidance, mage hand, message, suggestion, hold person, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 276, Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 206

monster.name: Zaratan
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zaratan makes one Bite attack and one Stomp attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d10 + 10) thunder damage.

action.name: Spit Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range 120 ft./240 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (6d8 + 10) force damage.

action.name: Spew Debris (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

action.name: Earth-Shaking Movement (Bonus Action)
action.text: After moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan sends a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken. The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is restrained, requiring a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become trapped.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The zaratan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The zaratan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Stomp
legendary.text: The zaratan makes one Stomp attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The zaratan moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Spit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The zaratan makes one Spit Rock attack.

legendary.name: Retract (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text:
The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained.
The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.

legendary.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.

legendary.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The zaratan emerges from its shell and makes one Spit Rock attack. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 278, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 201

monster.name: Zariel
monster.resist: cold, fire, radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
trait.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Zariel's darkvision.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Zariel regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zariel makes three Flail or Longsword attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Horrid Touch, if available.

action.name: Flail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) radiant damage, or 19 (2d10 + 8) radiant damage when used with two hands, plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

action.name: Horrid Touch (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or take 44 (8d10) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is blinded and deafened. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Zariel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 26):
• At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), major image, wall of fire • 3/Day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zariel can take one of the following lair actions; she can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:
Fireball: Zariel casts the fireball spell.
Infernal Illusions: Zariel casts the major image spell four times, targeting different areas with it. Zariel prefers to create images of intruders' loved ones being burned alive. Zariel doesn't need to concentrate on the spells, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round. Each creature that can see these illusions must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the illusion for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Zariel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Zariel regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Zariel uses Teleport.

legendary.name: Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to burn. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

monster.spells: alter self, detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility, major image, wall of fire, blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 280, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 180

monster.name: Zuggtmoy
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zuggtmoy makes three Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: 4-13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 4- 6) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Zuggtmoy casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22):
• At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants • 3/Day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth • 1/Day each: etherealness, teleport

action.name: Lair Actions
action.text:
On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zuggtmoy can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; he can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:
Rally Plants. Up to four plant creatures that are friendly to Zuggtmoy and that Zuggtmoy can see can use their reactions to move up to their speed and make one weapon attack. Summon Fungi. Zuggtmoy causes four gas spores or violet fungi to appear in unoccupied spaces that she chooses within the lair. They vanish after 1 hour. Unleash Spores. Zuggtmoy uses either her Infestation Spores or her Mind Control Spores, centered on a mushroom or other fungus within her lair, instead of on herself.

action.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy, which lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be.

action.name: Mind Control Spores (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Humanoids and Beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, a creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of Zuggtmoy for 24 hours. While infected in this way, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.

reaction.name: Protective Thrall
reaction.text: When Zuggtmoy is hit by an attack roll, one creature within 10 feet of her that is charmed by her is hit by the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Day)
legendary.text: Zuggtmoy can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Zuggtmoy regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Zuggtmoy makes one Pseudopod attack.

legendary.name: Exert Will
legendary.text: One creature charmed by Zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction, if a available, to move up to its speed as she directs or to make one weapon attack against a target that she designates.

monster.spells: detect magic, locate animals or plants, dispel magic, entangle, plant growth, etherealness, teleport
monster.description: Source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse p. 281, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes p. 157
